paper_abstract: This paper proposes a methodology for identifying data samples that are likely to be mislabeled in a c-class classification problem (dataset). The methodology relies on an assumption that the generalization error of a model learned from the data decreases if a label of some mislabeled sample is changed to its correct class. A general classification model used in the paper is OP-ELM; it also provides a fast way to estimate the generalization error by PRESS Leave-One-Out. It is tested on two toy datasets, as well as on real life datasets for one of which expert knowledge about the identified potential mislabels has been sought. (C) 2015 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.
paper_title: MD-ELM: Originally Mislabeled Samples Detection using OP-ELM Model
